sources.title: Agnes of God (1985)
sources.description: Agnes of God is a 1985 American mystery film directed by Norman Jewison and starring Jane Fonda, Anne Bancroft and Meg Tilly. It followsÂ  a novice nun named Sister Agnes who is found with a dead baby in her convent room, leading to an investigation into her mental state. A psychiatrist is assigned to determine if Agnes is competent to stand trial for manslaughter, uncovering themes of faith, innocence, and trauma as she navigates the complexities of Agnes's past and the secrets of the convent.

metadata.Plot: When a dead newborn is found wrapped in bloody sheets in a wastebasket in the bedroom of a young novitiate, psychiatrist Martha Livingston is called in to determine if the seemingly innocent novice, who knows nothing of sex or birth, is competent to stand trial for the baby's murder. While searching for the answer that her supervisors want, Dr. Livingston finds herself inevitably drawn into searching for the truth about the baby's conception and death. Despite the lack of cooperation that she receives from her own organization and the church itself, she eventually discovers more than she may have bargained for.
metadata.Actors: Jane Fonda, Anne Bancroft, Meg Tilly
metadata.Awards: Nominated for 3 Oscars. 2 wins & 5 nominations total
